thread.title: AS Monaco fall in the last quarter of an hour against Tottenham

author: TimothÃ© Beuret
title: AS Monaco fall in the last quarter of an hour against Tottenham
text:
Youth League: AS Monaco fall in the last quarter of an hour against Tottenham
It was a match that was long in the balance but unfortunately turned against them. After a goal-filled encounter, the Rouge et Blanc, who hosted Tottenham at the Performance Centre for the third matchday of the Youth League, finally faltered in the last quarter of an hour, despite a convincing and close first half (2-4). âœï¸
A strong first half
The Rouge et Blanc kicked off under beautiful sunshine at the Performance Center. From the opening minutes, Djimi TraorÃ©â€™s players pushed forward, and Joan Tincres shot into the side netting (1â€²). The match was very competitive, and Jules Stawiecki saved Thompsonâ€™s effort (9â€²).
On the counterattack, the Monaco number 9 found himself in front of the opposing goalkeeper but missed the target (10â€²). The Spurs countered and opened the scoring through Irow, after a fine team move (14â€², 0-1).
The Tincres-Haddani duo shines
The Rouge et Blanc responded immediately, but NahÃ«l Haddani unfortunately missed the target (17â€²). Joan Tincres, on the other hand, was perfectly set up by his attacking partner and managed to equalize after a fine display in the box (27â€², 1-1).
Before half-time, the number 11, once again, provided a perfect pass to Kenan Moulangou, who was denied by the Londonersâ€™ goalkeeper (36). The Rouge et Blanc finished the first half better, but the two teams went into the locker room with the score tied at 1-1.
C'est la pause au Centre de Performance, les deux Ã©quipes sont dos Ã  dos âš”ï¸
â€” AS Monaco ðŸ‡²ðŸ‡¨ (@AS_Monaco)
[October 22, 2025]
Tincres hits a double
The second half started in the same way and on a great pass from Nick Mokabakila, Joan Tincres did it again and headed the ball home to secure a brace (46th, 2-1). Following on from this, NahÃ«l Haddani found the Spurs goalkeeperâ€™s gloves (49â€²). The English recovered and Irow came up against a great Jules Stawiecki (54â€² and 56â€²), before Upson equalized with a header from a corner (58â€², 2-2).
Spurs take the lead again
The match was indecisive, and on a counterattack, the Londoners quickly launched their attack through their number 9, who once again stumbled against the last Monaco defender, who were clearly having a great day (65â€²). The French U19 international, however, was powerless against Thompson (74â€², 2-3). Reduced to ten men after a second yellow card for Kenan Moulangou (75â€²), the Rouge et Blanc were then saved twice by their goalkeeper (81â€²).
Looking ahead to the trip to BodÃ¸/Glimt
Unfortunately, from a corner, Black allowed Tottenham to take the lead with a powerful half-volley (82â€², 2-4). Monaco attempted to respond late in the game through substitute Chaihane Badoro, who saw his 20-meter shot saved by Archer (89â€²). AS Monaco thus lost 4-2 to Tottenham on Matchday 3 of the Youth League. The next match in the competition is Tuesday, November 4th (2 p.m.)., in BodÃ¸/Glimt.
